intro: Calceolaria soratensis, commonly known as the Andean slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that resemble tiny cups. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Calceolaria soratensis is often found in specialized ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
